saitMLS.problemDomain.clientale

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • saitMLS.problemDomain.clientale.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Client object is a representation of client data. The client is represented by a membership id, last name, first name, address, phone number, client type and active record status.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dave Watson
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      Stores the active status of this record in the random access file database of clients.
      private java.lang.String address
      Stores the client's current address as string of maximum size of 50 characters.
      private char clientType
      Stores the client type of this customer as to whether they are a residential (R) or commercial (C) client.
      private java.lang.String firstName
      Stores the client's first name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.
      private long id
      Stores the client membership id number.
      private java.lang.String lastName
      Stores the client's last name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.
      private java.lang.String phoneNumber
      Stores the client's current phone number as string of maximum size of 12 characters in the following format 403-222-5555.
      private java.lang.String postalCode
      Stores the client's current postal code as string of maximum size of 7 characters.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      static int SIZE
      Constant to store the number of bytes required to store a customer object in a Random Access File.

      Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values based on the string input..

      private void validatePostalCode(java.lang.String pc)
      Method to validate the Postal Code is in the correct format of A9A 9A9 and if it is not then the method throws an InvalidPostalCodeException.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SIZE

        public static final int SIZE
        Constant to store the number of bytes required to store a customer object in a Random Access File.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • id

        private long id
        Stores the client membership id number. Uniquely identifies the client with long integer value.

      • lastName

        private java.lang.String lastName
        Stores the client's last name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.

      • firstName

        private java.lang.String firstName
        Stores the client's first name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.

      • address

        private java.lang.String address
        Stores the client's current address as string of maximum size of 50 characters.

      • postalCode

        private java.lang.String postalCode
        Stores the client's current postal code as string of maximum size of 7 characters.

      • phoneNumber

        private java.lang.String phoneNumber
        Stores the client's current phone number as string of maximum size of 12 characters in the following format 403-222-5555.

      • active

        private boolean active
        Stores the active status of this record in the random access file database of clients. If the client's active status holds true the client is active. If client's active status is false then the client's record is deleted.

      • clientType

        private char clientType
        Stores the client type of this customer as to whether they are a residential (R) or commercial (C) client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Creates an instance of this object with default values.

      • Client

        public Client(long id,
      java.lang.String firstName,
      java.lang.String lastName,
      java.lang.String address,
      java.lang.String postalCode,
      java.lang.String phoneNumber,
      char clientType)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException
        Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values.
        Parameters:
        id - Holds the client's membership number.
        firstName - Holds the client's first name.
        lastName - Holds the client's last name.
        address - Holds the client's current address.
        postalCode - Holds the client's current postal code.
        phoneNumber - Holds the client's current phone number.
        clientType - Holds the client's type status R = residential and C = commercial.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException
        InvalidPostalCodeException

       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,

        Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values based on the string input..
        Parameters:
        line - Holds the customer's complete information
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException
        InvalidPostalCodeException

      • validatePostalCode

        private void validatePostalCode(java.lang.String pc)
                         throws InvalidPostalCodeException
        Method to validate the Postal Code is in the correct format of A9A 9A9 and if it is not then the method throws an InvalidPostalCodeException.
        Parameters:
        pc - the postal code to validate.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - if the postal code format is incorrect.

      • validatePhoneNumber

        private void validatePhoneNumber(java.lang.String pn)
                          throws InvalidPhoneNumberException
        Method to validate the Phone Number is in the correct format of 111-111-1111 and if it is not then the method throws an InvalidPhoneNumberException.
        Parameters:
        pn - the phone number to validate.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - if the phone number format is incorrect.
